Articles.Content: I tried and downloaded precisely the 27th April commit of EVE Overhaul and everything is just fine. And beautiful, of course!

I tried and downloaded precisely the 27th April commit of EVE Overhaul and everything is just fine. And beautiful, of course!

Oh brilliant!! Yeah it maybe be that some of the releases just after that one may work slightly better, though I'm not to sure

I'd like to attempt running this in the pre-release build of RSS. After grabbing the latest commit to EVE Overhaul, is there anything else I need to make a stab at running this with RSS? Textures? Configs? I understand they might not work right, but I'd like to try anyway and promise not to submit complaints or stomp around like an angry child and all that other behavior we tend to see around here from time to time.

I'd like to attempt running this in the pre-release build of RSS. After grabbing the latest commit to EVE Overhaul, is there anything else I need to make a stab at running this with RSS? Textures? Configs? I understand they might not work right, but I'd like to try anyway and promise not to submit complaints or stomp around like an angry child and all that other behavior we tend to see around here from time to time.

Ha! If you wan't anything remotely decent looking I'd give the overhaul posted above a try, though I haven't tried that older build in the new RSS yet myself. I've been using the latest overhaul which is proving very tricky to control but I'm getting there.. I think, allot of bugs still in the newest overhaul regarding the atmosphere shader and some problems with terrain being uncontrollable on RSS-modified planets.

I personally tried this using the latest EVE overhaul, and using the RSS Visual Enhancements in the .90 repo on Github, but unfortunately what I got was an Earth with pure white continents. I'll see if I installed it incorrectly in some way.

I also tried the April 28th release that the person above got working. Same issue, so I'm not sure what the problem is.

Edited June 12, 2015 by avi

I personally tried this using the latest EVE overhaul, and using the RSS Visual Enhancements in the .90 repo on Github, but unfortunately what I got was an Earth with pure white continents. I'll see if I installed it incorrectly in some way.

I also tried the April 28th release that the person above got working. Same issue, so I'm not sure what the problem is.

It's to do with the way RSS now assigns planets with new names.. I think.

Go into your RSS folder, find the RSSKopernicus.cfg and comment out (by adding //) the cbNameLater line so it looks like this:


// Earth
    Body
    {
        name = Kerbin
        //nameLater = Earth
        //cbNameLater = Earth      <<< This line
        Template
        {

Edited June 12, 2015 by pingopete

Thanks, that mostly fixed the problem! I am still having an issue in which ground detail textures don't work in scaled space, and in which clouds don't show within a certain radius of my ship when I'm in scaled space, but unless there's a known fix for it, I'm going to assume it's version compatibility and will be fixed in an update.

Thanks, that mostly fixed the problem! I am still having an issue in which ground detail textures don't work in scaled space, and in which clouds don't show within a certain radius of my ship when I'm in scaled space, but unless there's a known fix for it, I'm going to assume it's version compatibility and will be fixed in an update.

Which version of EVE/RSS/KSP is this happening with?

RSS in KSP 1 and with EVE really looks quite horrible, I really recommend rolling back to KSP0.9 for visuals else all I can say is the problems are happening on my end too :/ sorry
In PQS it looks the same as it did previously, it seems just to be in scaled space. I'll play RO without RVE for now and eagerly await the update. Thank you for your help.

In PQS it looks the same as it did previously, it seems just to be in scaled space. I'll play RO without RVE for now and eagerly await the update. Thank you for your help.

Ok, and again I'm sorry I can't do more to help or improve RVE at this time
That's fine, I'm really not complaining. It's not like I am helping myself; it'll be ready when it's ready.

Ok, and again I'm sorry I can't do more to help or improve RVE at this time

Dont be like that! you are doing awesome work man ! and we are thankfull for that any point in time!

Would someone be kind enough to make EVE compatible with the latest Real Solar System? Kerbal 1.02 Everything works fine except that the clouds don't show up on Mars and Venus only. RSS latest release has real planet names.
Awesome stuff, please consider putting a new download up sooner rather than later, we promise not to bother you with complaints

we promise not to bother you with complaints

You wouldn't, I wouldn't, but sooner or later someone would

Anyway, RSS just isn't the same without RVE! So if we can help somehow, I'm up for the challenge

The problem, as I understand it, has something to do with EVE not handling the renaming of planetary bodies? Is that correct or is there more to it than that?

Edit: I think there's also issues with shader conflicts with Kopernicus or some such thing.

Edited June 19, 2015 by jrandom

The problem, as I understand it, has something to do with EVE not handling the renaming of planetary bodies? Is that correct or is there more to it than that?

Edit: I think there's also issues with shader conflicts with Kopernicus or some such thing.

There is a quick fix for the new kopernicus stuff not being compatible with EVE. As far as current issues, it's mainly actually just trying to understand the new atmosphere shader in the EVE gui, there's something like 30 variables with only names like A, B, C, etc, but I have made some progress with it.

I'm also waiting on some features to be introduced in EVE, mainly mutliple detail layer levels so e.g. a close up grass texture and one for when viewed at 100,000ft, obviously the same texture wouldn't work for both. Another is having the cloud shadows conform to cloud detail when using transparency. Normals for textures would also be awesome!
Yay! So glad to hear you're making progress. RSS just isn't the same without your work.
This is great! I have tested it on the new RSS and I also get white continents. I'm not putting pressure on you but this is just a small bug report.
This looks beautiful

Go into your RSS folder, find the RSSKopernicus.cfg and comment out (by adding //) the cbNameLater line so it looks like this:

Edited June 20, 2015 by pingopete

At this moment in time, is there a way to get Earth clouds at least? RSS 10.1 is really beautiful and stable, it just feels a little incomplete without clouds. Reading this thread is confusing me, it sounds like some people have already done it, while others deny that it works (?)

It's to do with the way RSS now assigns planets with new names.. I think.

Go into your RSS folder, find the RSSKopernicus.cfg and comment out (by adding //) the cbNameLater line so it looks like this:


// Earth
    Body
    {
        name = Kerbin
        //nameLater = Earth
        //cbNameLater = Earth      <<< This line
        Template
        {

Ok that solve the problem:D Thanks

Also I notice that some places are under water but still nice!

I'm using ksp 1.0.2 and the 10.0.1 RSS

also hacked win64

EDIT: I have also something about cloud from like 2000m all the time sometimes they don't even show but when you are at that altidude then they show. This is a small bug report and I don't whant to put pressure on you because of this:)
